sources.title: Private Buckaroo (1942) SHEMP HOWARDüçï PATRIOTIC MUSICAL
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Director: Edward F. Cline
Stars: Dick Foran, Shemp Howard, Huntz Hall, Mary Wickes
Musical Stars: Harry James & his Music Makers, The Andrew Sisters, Helen Forrest

A rebellious young inductee has trouble toeing the line until he meets a retired officer's lovely daughter. Also drafted are Harry James and his Music Makers who decide to perk up their camp by putting on a big show with The Andrews Sisters. Loaded with classic songs & jitterbug dancing!

sources.title: Private Buckaroo (1942)
sources.description: The film tells the story of army recruits following basic training, with the Andrew Sisters attending USO dances. The film is a mixture of comedy and songs. Watch on RetroFlix:¬† https://retroflix.org/private-buckaroo-1942/

sources.title: Private Buckaroo
sources.description: You can find more information regarding this film on its IMDb page .

sources.title: Private Buckaroo
sources.description: WWII era Musical starring Dick Foran, the Andrew Sisters, Harry James, and Joe E Lewis. Dick Foran play a western style crooner who's anxious to join the Army. After he's enlisted he thinks he's to good for basic training which raises the ire of his fellow soldiers.

sources.title: Private Buckaroo (1942) Comedy, Romance, Musical
sources.description:
Nightclub performers (The Andrews Sisters, Dick Foran, Joe E. Lewis) do Army shows with Harry James and His Music Makers.

Director: Edward F. Cline
Writers: Edmond Kelso, Edward James
Stars: The Andrews Sisters, Dick Foran, Joe E. Lewis 
Genres: Classics, Comedy, Romance, Musical, War

metadata.Plot: A Universal Army enlistment promotion, produced as a musical showcase for Harry James, the Andrews Sisters, Joe E. Lewis, and Donald O'Connor & Peggy Ryan. The film's thin plot has James drafted, and joining him is the band's lead vocalist Lon Prentice (Dick Foran), who doesn't believe that Army training and regulations are necessary for anyone of his skill and fame. Shemp Howard steals the film whenever James and the Andrewses aren't performing. As Sgt. Snavely, he's effectively teamed with Mary Wickes as his shrewish fianc√©e, trying desperately to keep her away from the attentions of nightclub comic and USO performer Lancelot Pringle McBiff (Joe E. Lewis). Shemp also has the opportunity to clown onstage with the Andrews Sisters during a musical finale, as they perform Don't Sit Under the Apple Tree. Arguably, Shemp's best solo feature film credit.
metadata.Writer: Edmond Kelso, Edward James, Paul Gerard Smith
metadata.Actors: Harry James, Patty Andrews, Maxene Andrews
